title: Make Contact page social-media bubbles link to provided profiles

requirements.text: Update the social-media bubble links on the Contact page so that clicking each bubble opens the exact user-provided social profile URL in a new tab.

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx, the Facebook bubble uses href="https://www.facebook.com/share/1NmZG6UTZQ/".
In frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx, the YouTube bubble uses href="https://youtube.com/@thecreatorofsidequests?si=NDOq7CkgZu5Mxf_7".
In frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx, the TikTok bubble uses href="https://www.tiktok.com/@thecreatorofsidequests?_r=1&_t=ZT-93pCF5bOGo1".
In frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx, the Instagram bubble uses href="https://www.instagram.com/thecreatorofsidequests?igsh=Y2Y1OTE4ZWN1Y3I3".
All bubbles keep target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer" so they open safely in a new tab.

requirements.text: Ensure the social-media bubbles on the Contact page are visually and interactively “clickable” as bubbles (circular hit area), including clear hover and keyboard focus states consistent with the site theme.

quotes: when clicking the contact form and clicking the bubbles I should be able to click the bubbles and directly go to my social media

acceptanceCriteria: Each social icon link on the Contact page has a circular clickable area (e.g., equal height/width with rounded-full) that is comfortably tappable on mobile.
Each bubble has a visible hover state and a visible keyboard focus style (e.g., focus-visible ring) without breaking existing layout.
Icons remain accessible with appropriate aria-labels and do not trigger contact form submission.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not add or require any Facebook/Instagram/TikTok/YouTube API integration; links only.
nonGoals: Implementing real contact-form submission (email service, backend storage, or messaging integration).
Adding third-party authentication or social login.
